title: LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable
body_html:
I have installed pytorch in a python virtualenv.

So, when the cudnn.py library is looking for cudnn v5.1 it is not using the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable but instead using a relative path (i.e. libpaths = ['', path.join(thisdir, '../../lib')]). That relative path is where ever my python virtualenv is located. So, I am getting a run time error, "RuntimeError: dropout supported only in cudnn v5.1 and above".

Should this python module use the environment variable instead of the relative path? Because when updating to cudnn you update the libs in the $LD_LIBRARY_PATH path (i.e. libpaths = os.environ['LD_LIBRARY_PATH'].split(":")) ?

I have installed pytorch in a python virtualenv.

So, when the [cudnn.py](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/c0fc07eca031c47a75faf36e23a296bb897fd80d/torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py) library is looking for cudnn v5.1 it is not using the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable but instead using a relative path (i.e. libpaths = ['', path.join(thisdir, '../../lib')]). That relative path is where ever my python virtualenv is located. So, I am getting a run time error, "RuntimeError: dropout supported only in cudnn v5.1 and above".

Should this python module use the environment variable instead of the relative path?  Because when updating to cudnn you update the libs in the $LD_LIBRARY_PATH path  (i.e. libpaths = os.environ['LD_LIBRARY_PATH'].split(":")) ?
